{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Brandon Barker |image = Brandon Barker.jpg |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Brandon Lee Colin Barker{{cite web |url=https://vff.org.vn/tin-tuc-157/danh-sach-so-bo-cac-cau-thu-clb-manchester-city-tham-du-chuyen-du-dau-tai-viet-nam-25110.html |title=Danh sách sơ bộ các cầu thủ CLB Manchester City tham dự chuyến du đấu tại Việt Nam |trans-title=The preliminary list of Manchester City players to tour in Vietnam |publisher=Vietnam Football Federation |date=17 July 2017 |accessdate=12 February 2018 |language=Vietnamese}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|10|4|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Brandon Barker |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/brandon-barker-250014/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=3 October 2017}} |birth_place = [[Manchester]], England |height = {{convert|1.75|m|order=flip}} |position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] |currentclub = [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]]
(on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]) |clubnumber = 21 |youthyears1 = 2004–2015 |youthclubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City]] |years1 = 2015– |clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2015 |clubs2 = → [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] (loan) |caps2 = 4 |goals2 = 1 |years3 = 2016–2017 |clubs3 = → [[NAC Breda]] (loan) |caps3 = 22 |goals3 = 2 |years4 = 2017–2018 |clubs4 = → [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] (loan) |caps4 = 27 |goals4 = 2 |years5 = 2018– |clubs5 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) |caps5 = 12 |goals5 = 0 |pcupdate = 22:00, 22 December 2018 (UTC) |nationalyears1 = 2013–2014 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] |nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2014 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps2 = 5 |nationalgoals2 = 3 |nationalyears3 = 2015–2016 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps3 = 8 |nationalgoals3 = 3 |ntupdate = }} '''Brandon Lee Colin Barker''' (born 4 October 1996) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]], on loan from [[Manchester City F.C|Manchester City]], as a left sided [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]].{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/brandon-barker|title=Brandon Barker player profile - Manchester City Academy - Manchester City FC|work=mancity.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/brandon-barker|title=Brandon Barker - Manchester City FC|work=mancity.com}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/brandon-barker/314039/|title=England - B. Barker - Profile with news, career statistics and history - Soccerway|work=soccerway.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/man-city-starlet-brandon-barker-8482860|title=Man City starlet Brandon Barker leading new era of boy Blues|author=Simon Bajkowski|date=21 January 2015|work=men}} Barker has previously played on loan for [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]], [[NAC Breda]] and [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]]. He has also represented England at the [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] international levels. ==Club career== ===Manchester City=== Barker joined the [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City academy]] at the age of eight. He was the winner of the Academy Players' Player of the Year award in the 2013–14 season and signed his first professional contract with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in July 2014.https://www.mancity.com/brandon-barker In the opening months of the 2015–16 season he appeared on the first team bench for a number of times but did not manage to make an appearance.{{cite web|last=Brennan|first=Stuart|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-city-brandon-barker-academy-10426086|title=Manchester City youngster Brandon Barker speaks of his frustration sitting on Blues' bench|date=11 November 2015|publisher=Manchester Evening News|accessdate=5 November 2016}}{{cite web|last=Bajkowski|first=Simon|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-brandon-barker-keen-10297446|title=Man City: Brandon Barker keen on game time to keep moving forward|date=22 October 2015|publisher=Manchester Evening News|accessdate=5 November 2016}} Barker made his first-team debut for City on 21 February 2016, coming on as a substitute for [[Bersant Celina]] in a 5–1 defeat against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2015–16 FA Cup#Fifth Round Proper|fifth round]] of the [[FA Cup]].{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 5-1 Manchester City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35572091|accessdate=22 February 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=21 February 2016}} ====Loan to Rotherham United==== On 6 November 2015, Barker signed for [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] of the [[2015–16 Football League Championship|Championship]] on a loan with an initial length of two months.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34745707|title=Brandon Barker: Man City midfielder joins Rotherham on loan|date=6 November 2015|publisher=BBC|accessdate=5 November 2016}} The next day he made his professional debut, playing 90 minutes and scoring in a 5–2 loss to Ipswich.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34685921|title=Rotherham United 2–5 Ipswich Town|date=7 November 2015|publisher=BBC|accessdate=5 November 2016}} On 15 December 2015, Barker was recalled from his loan by Manchester City.{{cite news|last1=Veal|first1=Jonathan|title=Barker's Loan Spell Cut Short|date= 15 December 2015 |url=https://itsmillerstime.net/2015/12/15/brandon-barkers-loan-spell-at-rotherham-cut-short-by-manchester-city/|publisher= Millers Time|accessdate= 20 August 2016}} ====2016–17: loan to NAC Breda==== In August 2016, Barker was sent to [[NAC Breda]] of the Dutch [[Eerste Divisie]] on loan for the [[2016-17 Eerste Divisie|2016-17]] season.{{cite news|last1= Bajkowski|first1= Simon|title= Barker Moves to NAC Breda On Loan |date= 15 August 2016 |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-brandon-barker-loan-11752734|publisher= Manchester Evening News|accessdate= 20 August 2016}} He made his debut on 19 August, as a substitute in a 1–2 loss to [[MVV Maastricht|Maastricht]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/08/22/loan-watch-22-august-enes-unal-nets-16-minute-hat-trick/1471866725522|title=LOAN WATCH: UNAL NETS HAT-TRICK OF GOLAZOS|publisher=mancity.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}} His first goal came on 21 October, in a 3–1 win over [[Fortuna Sittard]].{{cite web|last=Dirven|first=Johan|url=http://breda.nieuws.nl/sport/193789/ontlading-parel-broodnodige-winst-op-fortuna/|title=Ontlading bij de Parel na broodnodige winst op Fortuna|language=Dutch|date=21 October 2016|publisher=breda.nieuws.nl|accessdate=30 October 2016}} ====2017–18: loan to Hibernian==== On 17 August 2017, Barker was loaned to [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] for the 2017–18 season.{{cite web|title=Hibernian sign Brandon Barker on loan|url=http://www.hibernianfc.co.uk/news/7789|publisher=Hibernian FC|accessdate=17 August 2017}} Barker said in November that he had been encouraged to move to Scotland by the example of [[Patrick Roberts]], a winger who had moved on loan from Manchester City to [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41862995 |title=Patrick Roberts' success on loan at Celtic inspired Brandon Barker to join Hibs |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=3 November 2017 |accessdate=5 November 2017 |first=Brian |last=McLauchlin}} Barker scored his first goal for Hibs in a 2–1 win against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]] on 31 January, but then suffered a torn hamstring in his next match.{{cite news |url=https://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/sport/football/hibs/hibs-winger-brandon-barker-ruled-out-until-april-1-4683530 |title=Hibs winger Brandon Barker ruled out until April |first=Anthony |last=Brown |work=Edinburgh Evening News |publisher= |date=5 February 2018 |accessdate=22 April 2018}} Towards the end of the season, Barker said he expected to be loaned out again by Manchester City and that he would be interested in returning to Hibs.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44044154 |title=Hearts v Hibernian: Brandon Barker eyes further growth at Easter Road |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=9 May 2018 |accessdate=14 May 2018}} ====2017–18: loan to Preston North End==== Barker joined [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on loan for the 2018–19 season.{{cite web |title=Preston North End Sign Manchester City’s Brandon Barker On A Season-Long Loan |url=https://www.pnefc.net/news/2018/august/preston-north-end-sign-manchester-citys-brandon-barker-on-a-season-long-loan/ |publisher=Preston North End|accessdate=7 August 2018}} Barker's first goal for Preston North End came in a 3-1 win over [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]] in the [[EFL Cup|Carabao Cup]] on Tuesday, August 14, 2018.{{cite web |title=Carabao Cup: Preston North End beat Morecambe 3-1 to reach second round |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45092624 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=14 August 2018}} ==International career== Barker made his international debut for [[England national under-18 football team|England under-18]] in October 2013 and went on to play for his country at the [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] levels. ==Career statistics== {{updated|06:27, 8 December 2018 (UTC)}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Championship|Championship]] |12||0||0||0||3||2||colspan="2"|—||15||2 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !65||5|||3||0||5||2||colspan="2"|—||73||7 |} {{reflist|group=note}} ==Honours== '''Individual''' *[[Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Manchester City EDS]] Player of the Year: 2013–2014{{cite web|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/man-city-starlet-brandon-barker-8482860|title=Man City starlet Brandon Barker leading new era of boy Blues|publisher=Manchester Evening News|accessdate=21 September 2016}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Soccerway|brandon-barker/314039}} * {{Soccerbase}} * [https://www.mancity.com/brandon-barker Manchester City EDS profile] * [http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players?p=355753 England profile] at The FA {{Preston North End F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Barker, Brandon}} [[Category:1996 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:Manchester City F.C. players]] [[Category:Rotherham United F.C. players]] [[Category:NAC Breda players]] [[Category:Hibernian F.C. players]] [[Category:Preston North End F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Eredivisie players]] [[Category:Eerste Divisie players]] [[Category:Scottish Professional Football League players]] [[Category:English expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in the Netherlands]] [[Category:English expatriate sportspeople in the Netherlands]]
